page.title: 13BUILTH (W): RELIGION
page.content: Builth (W) serves as the religious centre of the surrounding area.St. Mary's Parish Church is part of the Church of Wales in the diocese of Swansea and Brecon.The church tower is 14th century,but the rest of the church was rebuilt in 1875.The Reverend Elwyn John is the vicar. A number of nonconformist churches surround the parish church : Horeb United Reform Church Wesleyan Methodist Church,Memorial Baptist Church and just out side the D-block, Alpha Calvinistic Methodist Church.These churches generally have congregations of ten to twenty and share a minister with other churches.Further west but still in Builth (W) there is the Roman Catholic Church.This is a very lively church at the moment,attracting quite a large congregation,of all ages.
